intro: Sphaerocionium antillense, commonly known as the West Indian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruit. The plant typically grows as a shrub with palmate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit, which resembles a star, is edible and has a tangy, acidic flavor. Sphaerocionium antillense is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
